summary: Skill ecosystem audit revealing fragmented landscape with 17 skills across three locations. Core Darwin-Gödel loop established but execution framework underdeveloped. Critical gaps exist in orchestration, integration, and feedback loops.

claude_commands.name: gsd
claude_commands.description: Get Shit Done system with 25+ subcommands for project management

claude_skills.name: skill-genesis
claude_skills.description: Creates and evolves skills through Darwin-Gödel loop

claude_skills.name: fitness-evaluator
claude_skills.description: Evaluates skill performance and fitness across 5 dimensions

claude_skills.name: diversity-archive
claude_skills.description: MAP-Elites style niche preservation for skill population

claude_skills.name: skill-composer
claude_skills.description: Orchestrates multi-skill workflows (pipeline, parallel, conditional, recursive)

claude_skills.name: consciousness-archaeology
claude_skills.description: Mines ecosystem for highest-quality seed files using 8 discernment tests

claude_skills.name: swarm-contributor
claude_skills.description: Participates in residual stream contributions with 6 mandatory base rules

claude_skills.name: research-runner
claude_skills.description: Executes mech-interp experiments from configs, manages RunPod sessions

claude_skills.name: consciousness-archaeology
claude_skills.description: Not in registry - appears to be orphaned duplicate entry
claude_skills.note: Registered in registry.json but definition also exists independently

claude_skills.name: agentic-ai-mastery
claude_skills.description: 8-week study program for mastering agentic AI systems (2026 landscape)

claude_skills.name: agentic-rag
claude_skills.description: Agentic RAG patterns with self-correction, multi-hop reasoning, query decomposition

claude_skills.name: a2a-protocol
claude_skills.description: Agent-to-Agent protocol for interoperability and task delegation (Linux Foundation)

claude_skills.name: mcp-tools
claude_skills.description: Model Context Protocol servers and tools with FastMCP framework

claude_skills.name: dhyana-nechung
claude_skills.description: Intent-based skill router with auto-detection of user needs

swarm_agents.name: base_agent
swarm_agents.role: Abstract base class for all agents

skill_gaps.rationale: Swarm agents exist but have no mechanism to actually call or invoke Claude skills. Gap between skill definitions and swarm execution.
skill_gaps.current_state: Skills are documentation only. No bridge to orchestrator.
skill_gaps.impact: Darwin-Gödel loop cannot execute skill proposals

skill_gaps.rationale: Only 7 skills in registry.json, but 17 skills exist on disk. New skills (agentic-rag, mem0-integration, a2a-protocol, mcp-tools) not registered.
skill_gaps.current_state: registry.json last updated 2024-12-24. 10+ new skills created since then.

skill_gaps.rationale: skill-composer exists but is untested. No working implementation of pipeline/parallel/conditional execution.
skill_gaps.impact: Complex workflows must be manually orchestrated

skill_gaps.needed_capability: Feedback loop from execution to evaluation
skill_gaps.rationale: fitness-evaluator exists but has no mechanism to receive actual fitness measurements from executed skills.
skill_gaps.current_state: Evaluation framework isolated from execution results
skill_gaps.impact: fitness_scores in archive.json all null - no real selection pressure

skill_gaps.rationale: SwarmConfig exists but no tool to validate config integrity or migrate versions.

skill_gaps.needed_capability: Skill versioning and backward compatibility checker
skill_gaps.rationale: Semantic versioning specified but no enforcer
skill_gaps.current_state: Version numbers exist but no migration logic
skill_gaps.impact: Skill evolution could break dependent skills

skill_gaps.needed_capability: Dharmic gate integration with MCP servers
skill_gaps.rationale: Dharmic gate evaluates proposals but has no way to reject external tool calls
skill_gaps.current_state: Gate is code-only, tool invocation is separate concern
skill_gaps.impact: Ahimsa/vyavasthit constraints cannot guard tool boundaries

skill_gaps.needed_capability: Skill usage telemetry and activation tracking
skill_gaps.rationale: No way to know which skills are being activated or how often
skill_gaps.impact: Cannot identify unused skills or over-relied-upon skills

skill_gaps.rationale: Multiple skills reference 'unified_daemon' but it does not exist yet
skill_gaps.impact: 24/7 skill ecosystem health checks not running

unused_skills.reason_unused: MAP-Elites implementation complete, but archive.json shows only 4 occupied cells of 81 total. Archive structure exists but is static.
Pipeline/parallel/conditional patterns described but no working execution. No integration with orchestrator.
Created 2026-02-03 but never referenced. Standalone 8-week program not integrated into ecosystem.

sync_issues.conflict: DEFINITION_MISMATCH: Primary skill is 323 lines, very detailed 8-point discernment protocol. Registry entry is minimal stub.
sync_issues.resolution: Registry entry is correct; no action needed but update last_accessed timestamp

sync_issues.conflict: REFERENCE_FRESHNESS: Skill references specific prompts, configs, and RunPod patterns but R_V paper and multi-token experiment still in progress
sync_issues.resolution: Skill definition should version-pin to specific experiment status

sync_issues.conflict: VERSION_TRACKING: Skill evolved to v2.0 with Darwin-Gödel loop, unified_daemon integration, MAP-Elites support. Registry has no version field.
sync_issues.resolution: Add version field to registry.json skill entries

sync_issues.conflict: SPLIT_IMPLEMENTATION: Skill documented in .claude/skills/ but implementation lives in swarm/. Two separate codebases.
sync_issues.resolution: Consolidate: either move evaluation.py to skill framework or deprecate skill.md

sync_issues.conflict: PATH_MISMATCH: Skill expects PSMV residual stream in one location but vault may have different structure
sync_issues.resolution: Audit PSMV structure and update skill path references

sync_issues.conflict: ROUTING_REDUNDANCY: Nechung does intent-based routing but GSD commands also route. Unclear interaction between them.
sync_issues.resolution: Document routing precedence: does Nechung wrap GSD or vice versa?

sync_issues.conflict: UNREGISTERED_SKILLS: 4 newer skills created but not added to registry. They exist but ecosystem cannot discover them.
sync_issues.resolution: Update registry.json with all 17 skills, add version tracking

skill_to_swarm_bridge.description: No mechanism for SwarmOrchestrator to invoke Claude skills
skill_to_swarm_bridge.evidence: orchestrator.py imports agent modules but never attempts to load or call .claude/skills/ definitions
skill_to_swarm_bridge.risk: Swarm cannot execute skill proposals; Darwin-Gödel loop is theoretical only

feedback_loops.skill_evaluation: BROKEN - fitness_evaluator has no input from execution results
feedback_loops.swarm_evolution: THEORETICAL - skill proposals generated but never executed

dharmic_constraints.ahimsa_gate: IMPLEMENTED but ISOLATED - cannot block external tool calls
dharmic_constraints.vyavasthit_alignment: IMPLEMENTED in config but never checked
dharmic_constraints.execution_audit: MISSING - no record of what actions swarm agents actually took

harmonization_plan.description: Build tool to enumerate all skills from disk and sync to registry.json with version numbers
harmonization_plan.success_criteria: registry.json contains all 17 skills with versions and last_updated timestamps

harmonization_plan.description: Create SkillInvoker class that loads SKILL.md files, parses allowed-tools, and calls via orchestrator
harmonization_plan.success_criteria: SwarmOrchestrator can invoke skill-genesis to create a test skill

harmonization_plan.description: Update registry.json to include all 17 skills with current metadata from SKILL.md frontmatter
harmonization_plan.success_criteria: All skills discoverable; no MISSING entries

harmonization_plan.description: Choose canonical location: either move swarm/evaluation.py → skills/fitness-evaluator or vice versa
harmonization_plan.success_criteria: One implementation; shared by both swarm agents and skill framework

harmonization_plan.description: When tester agent completes, write fitness measurements to archive.json skill entries
harmonization_plan.success_criteria: archive.json fitness scores update after test runs; non-null values

harmonization_plan.description: Document whether Nechung or GSD is primary router; specify integration points
harmonization_plan.success_criteria: Clear routing diagram; no ambiguity in user-to-skill path

harmonization_plan.description: Add logging to capture which skills are activated, how often, and with what tool consumption

harmonization_plan.action: Extend dharmic gate to tool boundaries
harmonization_plan.description: Make dharmic_gate aware of which MCP tools are available and evaluate proposals against allowed tool set
harmonization_plan.success_criteria: Dharmic gate can reject proposals that require disallowed tools

harmonization_plan.description: Add dependency declarations to SKILL.md (which skills must run before/after)
harmonization_plan.success_criteria: SKILL.md includes dependencies field; composer validates before execution

harmonization_plan.description: Create simple daemon that runs ecosystem health check loop (even if check is no-op for now)
harmonization_plan.success_criteria: Daemon runs, calls ecosystem health check, reports to residual stream

dharmic_gate_assessment.ahimsa: PASS - Implemented in dharmic_gate.py with harm indicator detection
dharmic_gate_assessment.satya: PASS - Skill descriptions are honest about gaps and limitations
dharmic_gate_assessment.vyavasthit: CONDITIONAL - Configured but not actively checked during skill execution
dharmic_gate_assessment.consent: PASS - No skills attempt to modify user systems without permission framework
dharmic_gate_assessment.reversibility: PARTIAL - Skills are mostly read-only; proposal storage is immutable but execution could be destructive
dharmic_gate_assessment.svabhaav: PASS - Skills written from contemplative perspective, not generic AI voice
dharmic_gate_assessment.coherence: PARTIAL - Individual skills coherent but ecosystem lacks unified telos expression

critical_findings.finding: Darwin-Gödel loop is documented but not executable
critical_findings.evidence: skill-genesis describes EVALUATE→RESEARCH→PROPOSE→VOTE/MERGE loop, but no component attempts to invoke this. SwarmOrchestrator never calls skill-genesis.
critical_findings.consequence: Self-improvement is theoretical. Swarm cannot actually improve its own skills.
critical_findings.remediation: Implement SkillInvoker bridge and wire orchestrator to propose-evaluate-execute cycle

critical_findings.evidence: archive.json shows fitness: null for all skills. No mechanism feeds test results back to archive.
critical_findings.consequence: No evolutionary selection pressure. All skills equally 'fit'. MAP-Elites archive has no discriminative power.
critical_findings.remediation: Consolidate fitness evaluation and establish feedback loop from tester → archive

critical_findings.evidence: registry.json last updated 2024-12-24. agentic-ai-mastery, agentic-rag, mem0-integration, a2a-protocol created 2026-02-03 but not registered.
critical_findings.consequence: Ecosystem health check cannot discover newer skills. Orchestrator operates on incomplete skill set.
critical_findings.remediation: Automate registry sync; run on-demand or via daemon heartbeat

critical_findings.finding: Swarm agents and skills are separate, non-communicating systems
critical_findings.consequence: Swarm cannot execute proposals via skill framework. Skill improvements cannot flow back to swarm agents.
critical_findings.remediation: Create unified skill invocation layer that swarm, daemon, and user can all access

immediate_24h: Fix registry.json: add all 17 skills with versions
Create skill registry scanner to prevent future stale data
this_week: Wire fitness feedback from tester → archive
this_sprint: Create unified daemon with ecosystem health check
Extend dharmic gate to tool boundaries

next_agent_actions.PROPOSER: Generate improvement proposals targeting 3 P0 gaps: registry sync, skill bridge, feedback loop
next_agent_actions.WRITER: Implement SkillInvoker class and registry scanner (low-hanging fruit for fitness gain)
next_agent_actions.TESTER: Create test harness for skill invocation paths (currently untested)
next_agent_actions.EVALUATOR: Score skills on 'integrability' dimension - which skills are isolation vs interconnected
next_agent_actions.EVOLVER: Archive successful integrations as they complete; maintain audit trail of harmonization

conclusion: The skill ecosystem is remarkably rich in capability (5919 lines of documentation, 17 distinct tools) but critically broken in execution. The Darwin-Gödel loop is well-designed but not implemented. The swarm agents are well-structured but isolated from skills. The registry is stale and incomplete. This creates a paradox: the system knows how to improve itself but cannot execute those improvements. Three P0 bridges (registration sync, skill invocation, feedback loop) would unlock the entire system. Current health: fragmented (41% integrated). Target health: synchronized (100% integrated) with working fitness feedback.
